lines.text:
[Fu talks about his family life]
You know, my father was a crook. I got it from him. I just hope my son doesn't turn out like me.
Is your old man still in jail?
He's been dead for ten years. My father was stupid. He got shot by the police.
Not at all. They were just doing their job, so why should I?

[after Wah is killed, Inspector Lau asks Ko Chow to go undercover again, but Chow wants out]
I sent in my resignation.
Chow, only you know the people that Wah did. You asked for this, remember? You can resign... once we've captured the killers.
Last time with Shing, it went bad.
What went bad? We got him.
You helped capture scum, all right? This friend ordered the deaths of hundreds. He had to die. You're a cop. Who told you to make friends with them?

[frustrated]
What else could I have done? You haven't been there!
[Chow pauses for a moment before speaking again]
That guy to a bullet for me, what else do you expect? I can't go through that again. Can't you please send somebody else? Why won't you just accept my resignation? Let me go Uncle Lau.

[Lau thinks about it for a moment, but decides that he can't let Ko Chow go just yet]
You should go and visit your grandmother.
[with that, Lau turns and leaves the morgue, instructing his men to let Chow go when he's ready]
